intro: Vandellia brownii, commonly known as the Brown's vandellia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, humid environments such as marshes and swamps. It has a short, stout stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Vandellia brownii is often found in association with water, showcasing its adaptation to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats.
